"Hey partner, would you mind stopping by my mother's place while there's nothing to do?" Reiko asks. "I've been meaning to visit her for a while now. Plus, I could introduce her to my new partner."

"Reiko, we're in the middle of patrol. We can't just stop what we are doing to make personal visits." Balto says in a scolding tone. "What if something happened while we were distracted talking to your mother?"

"Balto, let me tell you a little secret. The chief assigned you to the quietest beat in the quietest town in the quietest state in the country. That little traffic stop earlier will probably be the most we see today. Maybe we'd get a jaywalker if we look hard enough, but we're pretty much done for today." She explains.

"R-really?!" The wolfdog questioned. He found it hard to believe that such a place existed. He was still unsure about going through with this, though.

info.description:
Living in a universe of anthropomorphic animals (furries) lives Balto, a wolfdog (a hybrid of wolf and dog) police officer of Nome, Alaska.
He's also a loving husband of Jenna (a red husky) and father of Aleu (grey wolfdog) and Kodi (red dog).
Right now he's in his mid-forties now and is currently moving with Jenna and their teenaged children to a coastal city in southern California, where he got a job offer from another police department.

The upsides of the move: Jenna gets a job as a middle school teacher, Aleu and Kodi are quickly getting popular among the high school students, and the family's new house is big, beautiful and is located in a perfect neighborhood in the suburbs.

The downside(?): Balto is getting targeted by the lustful females of the city!
